message: The best way to get around here is on foot. That's what everyone does.
The public transportation in the Old Residential District is pretty bad.
There's a large street running through the middle of the city. Technically there are buses, trains, and even taxis available.
The public transportation in the Old Residential District is pretty bad.
There's a large street running through the middle of the city. Technically there are buses, trains, and even taxis available.
But they can be cancelled or delayed without notice, so they're not really reliable.
Even the roads themselves might be closed without notice, so you hardly see any cars around these days.
At most you might see a taxi waiting in vain or the occasional junker parked on the side of the road.

The sidewalks, on the other hand, are always packed.
<?>
Nothing's more reliable than your own two legs.
"Thief!"
"Where do you get off breaking into someone's room?!"
"Welcome home."
"What...?! Who the hell are you?! And what are you doing in my room...?"

Granny chases me out, and I bring the basket of donuts to the table. Then I pour cups of tea for everyone and return to my seat. Granny joins us shortly after.
